intro: Fourraea alpina, commonly known as the alpine fourraea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine habitats. Fourraea alpina is adapted to cold climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
